ABC 2 Personal and Possessive Pronoun Sentences - WS PA (Set 1 and 2)

Students recieved a worksheet with 8 sentences in ASL gloss already. Each  
sentence used family signs where students had to eaxplain how people were  
related to each other using singular and possessive pronouns.

They practiced their sentences in table groups, then they found a partner who  
had an opposite paper to them. They signed their sentences to a partner and  
wrote in English what their partner signed to them.

They wre given class time on 1-10 to complete. - Link: http://puyallupsd.schoology.com/assignment/6528650126

Students practiced the formatting for their expressive semester final, as  
this is a new type of test they have not experiences before. - Link: http://puyallupsd.schoology.com/assignment/6523150893
Students create some team norms for Task One. - Link: http://puyallupsd.schoology.com/assignment/6526064855

Students learned how to sing information about various languages. They then  
created 5 sentences following the prompts below:

1. Family member, SPEAKS, language

2. Family member, KNOW, language

3. Family member, LEARN, language, amount remembers (MOST, SOME, LITTLE BIT,  
ALL)

4. Family member, STUDY, language, # years

5. Family members, TAKE-UP, language, # years

After they created their sentences, they found a partner and signed them to  
them. They wrote in English what their partner signed to them. They had class  
time on 11/12 to complete this activity.Â  - Link: http://puyallupsd.schoology.com/assignment/6528453269
AP Task One Agreement Forms Turned In
Students and guardians sign and turn in their AP Task One Agreement forms. - Link: http://puyallupsd.schoology.com/assignment/6533879172
Dihybrid Crosses & Rule of Multiplication Practice
Colleges and Languages Activity - Mad Lib Style - WS PA

Students learned how to sign different levels of schooling (elementary,  
junior high, high school and college).

They were then given a worksheet with some phrases writeen in ASL gloss. Each  
phrase had some blank lines in it that students had to fill in (like you do  
in a Mad Libs game).

They then signed their phrases to a partner and wrote what their partner  
signed to them in English.

They were given class time on 1/17 to complete. A few students completed  
first thing in class on 1/18 as they ran out of time to finish the class  
prior. - Link: http://puyallupsd.schoology.com/assignment/6537039783

Students watched 2 short conversation videos that were posted on Schoology.  
They recieved a worksheet with questions they had to answer by watching the  
videos and understanding what the signer's in the video were signing. This  
helps students practice their receptive skills.

They were given time in class on 11-18 to complete.

Once they completed this activity, they were supposed to watch the first  
vocab video in the Unit 2 folder to preview the last vocabualry for the unit  
that we will be learning tomorrow. - Link: http://puyallupsd.schoology.com/assignment/6537573889
Students complete a one-pager showing their research so far. - Link: http://puyallupsd.schoology.com/assignment/6536941204
